noun.description: A priest who hears confessions and gives absolution and spiritual counsel.
examples: she sent for her confessor because she was in mortal sin

noun.description: A person who avows religious faith in the face of opposition, but does not suffer martyrdom.
A person who makes a confession.
examples: if one prisoner confesses and implicates the other, the confessor will go free as a reward

origin: Old English (in confessor (sense 2)): from Old French confessour, from ecclesiastical Latin confessor, from Latin confess- acknowledged (see confess).
